answers.answer: P.S. Here's what the fasciculations look like:http://youtu.be/i23DoNFDjCE

question: I'm a bit worried about twitching symptoms.I'm male, 49, thin, eat well, exercise regularly (run around 25-30 km / week).Starting a 1.5 yrs ago, I noticed fasciculations in my lower legs and feet. They seem to be in all muscles below the knee. They are constant, several/second. Two additional symptoms over the last year and a half: general fatigue, and I feel increasingly "sluggish" when I run. It's a dramatic change, like I've suddenly aged 20 years. But I haven't lost any strength.Ruled out:- Thyroid problems.- Diabetes.- Lyme disease (well, mostly ruled out, I had low IgG levels, but my IgM were 36 (reference: <22). The doctors said it seems like a false positive, but they're redoing the test.I just had a nerve conduction test done. I'm in Sweden, for a variety of reasons I can't get the results interpreted for another month. I got the raw numbers though. So here's my question.All the "N tibialis - med abd hall" numbers looked fine, on both sides. (And they were very nearly symmetrical, although the "fossa poplitea - med mall" ampl was 6.5 mV on the right, 12.5 mV on the left.)But the numbers for the N peroneus were slightly above (and in one case near) the max values given.Here are the numbers:N peroneus - m ext dig br(latency | speed | ampl)R: prox om caput fib -- distal:  NA | 47	| 2.0L: prox om caput fib -- distal:  NA | 53	| 3.3Normal values: 		NA |	40| NA (max lat | min speed | min ampl)R: dist om caput fib -- heel	NA |	45	| 2.1L: dist om caput fib -- heel 	NA |	51	| 3.1Normal values:	""R: heel       5.0 | 	NA |	3.1L: heel	 5.2 | 	NA | 	4.7Normal values:	5.3 	NA	2R: F-response	45.4 |	 ampl-quotient: |  65%L: F-response	54.0*  |	ampl-quotient: |  70%Normal values: 53	| NA | NAR: F-M-latency	40.4	| F resp % |	45L: F-M-latency	48.8* | F resp % |	80Normal values: 48 |	F-percentage | NAThe starred values are what I'm wondering about. What might they mean? Should I be worried?Thanks!
title: Fasciculations -- odd nerve conduction results?
